name: SysML v2 Specialization Relationship Analysis
description: Identify all specialization (inheritance) relationships in a SysML v2 model, understanding the type hierarchy.
prompt:
Analyze the specialization relationships in this SysML v2 model.

Identify all specialization relationships using the `:>` or `specializes` syntax. For each specialization:
1. Identify the child type (the one being defined)
2. Identify the parent type (the one being specialized)
3. Note the kind of definition (item def, part def, port def, etc.)

Return a JSON object with:
- "specializations": array of objects with "child", "parent", and "kind" fields
- "hierarchy": a text representation showing the inheritance tree

Example format:
```json
{
  "specializations": [
    {"child": "Car", "parent": "Vehicle", "kind": "part def"},
    {"child": "Truck", "parent": "Vehicle", "kind": "part def"}
  ],
  "hierarchy": "Vehicle\n  ├── Car\n  └── Truck"
}
```

rubric.completeness: 1.0: All specialization relationships found (SalesOrder, MaterialOrder, ProductOrder, PurchaseOrder, Inquiry, OrderQuotation, OrderConfirmation all specialize GeneralOrder). 0.5: Most relationships found but missing 1-2. 0.0: Missing more than half of the relationships.
rubric.accuracy: 1.0: All child-parent pairs correctly identified with correct 'kind' (item def). 0.5: Some relationships have wrong parent or kind. 0.0: Majority of relationships incorrectly identified.
rubric.hierarchy_clarity: 1.0: Hierarchy diagram clearly shows GeneralOrder as root with all specializations as children. 0.5: Hierarchy present but formatting is unclear or incomplete. 0.0: No hierarchy provided or completely wrong structure.
